text: Formoso is a city in Jewell County, Kansas, United States. As of the 2020 census, 94 people lived there. == History == The first post office at Formoso was founded in December 1887. Formoso was founded about 1889. == Geography == Formoso is at (39.779355, -97.992458). According to the United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. == People == === 2020 census === The 2020 census says that there were 94 people, 43 households, and 22 families living in Formoso. Of the households, 93.0% owned their home and 7.0% rented their home. The median age was 37.5 years. Of the people, 87.2% were White, 3.2% were from some other race, and 9.6% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 9.6% of the people. === 2010 census === The 2010 census says that there were 93 people, 48 households, and 26 families living in the city. == Education == Formoso is a part of USD 107 Rock Hills Schools. The Rock Hills High School mascot is Rock Hills Grizzlies. Formoso schools closed through school unification. The Formoso High School mascot was Formoso Falcons."The good ole days", The Salina Journal, 1 December 1994, p.17. == References == == Other websites == ;City * Formoso - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 107, local school district ;Maps * Formoso City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Jewell County, Kansas
title: Formoso, Kansas
